definition: the dropping of a sound or sounds in the middle of a word when it is spoken, for example the pronunciation of library as /laɪbri/
very informal words and expressions that are more common in spoken language, especially used by a particular group of people, for example, children, criminals, soldiers, etc.
the crime of killing somebody deliberately
used to describe something that is difficult or unpleasant
to do whatever you want without being stopped or punished
to scream loudly and for a long time, especially in order to protest about something
the state of having more than one possible meaning
a word or statement that can be understood in more than one way
the state of being difficult to understand or explain because of involving many different aspects

a layer of something that other things lie or rest on

that has been damaged or injured; no longer whole or working correctly

to go away or back quickly, especially to avoid something unpleasant
to mark or follow the rhythm of music, by waving a stick, tapping your foot (= hitting it against the floor), etc.
to get or do something before somebody else can
(to hit somebody until they are) covered with bruises (= blue, brown or purple marks on the body)
used to express surprise or anger
if you cannot defeat somebody or be as successful as they are, then it is more sensible to join them in what they are doing and perhaps get some advantage for yourself by doing so
far away from other people, houses, etc.
a fact, an argument, etc. that is used in order to blame or punish somebody
to be difficult to beat
not speaking; not expressed in speech
unable to speak

a space or opening that goes all the way through something

a fault or weakness in something such as a plan, law or story
a place or position that needs to be filled because somebody/something is no longer there
a secret advantage, for example a piece of information or a skill, that you are ready to use if you need to
if money burns a hole in your pocket, you want to spend it as soon as you have it

in a difficult situation
owing money

to find the weak points in something such as a plan, suggestion, etc.

considered so offensive or embarrassing that people must not mention it
a person in your family who lived a long time ago

an early form of a machine that later became more developed
a person or thing from the past that a person, animal or plant that is alive now is related to

lasting for a long time; difficult to cure

lasting a long time; difficult to solve
very bad

remaining constant in your support of somebody/something

not especially good; ordinary

used when you are stating that there is nothing more that can be said about something or that something is completely finished
either of the two long parts that stick out from the top of the body and connect the shoulders to the hands

very long

if you welcome somebody with open arms, you are extremely happy and pleased to see them
